section.section: The term of a member appointed by the Governor is 4 years.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who serves two consecutive 4-year terms may not be reappointed for 4 years after the completion of those terms.
If a vacancy occurs among the members appointed by the Governor, the Governor shall promptly appoint a successor.
